[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-schedule/src/ver.rs] [Module: gas_feature_versions] [Regression testing] The changelog shows many version-gated bug fixes (V21 type conversion fix, V34 function compatibility) - are there regression tests ensuring these bugs cannot be re-exploited through version manipulation? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-schedule/src/ver.rs] [Comment: Lines 5-74] [Changelog accuracy] The changelog documents gas changes per version, but can discrepancies between documented and actual feature gate checks lead developers to incorrectly assume features are/aren't available at certain versions, introducing security bugs? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-schedule/src/ver.rs] [Module: gas_feature_versions] [Constant naming] The RELEASE_V1_XX naming suggests mainnet releases, but version values are used for feature gating - can confusion between release versions and feature versions cause developers to use wrong version checks in gas-critical code? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-schedule/src/ver.rs] [Constant: LATEST_GAS_FEATURE_VERSION] [Zero version edge case] What happens if gas_feature_version is 0 (default for uninitialized state)? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-schedule/src/ver.rs] [Module: gas_feature_versions] [Version comparison overflow] If code uses subtraction for version comparisons (e.g., current_version - required_version), can underflow when current_version < required_version cause logic errors that bypass version checks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-schedule/src/ver.rs] [Constant: LATEST_GAS_FEATURE_VERSION] [Multi-version attack] Can an attacker submit a batch of transactions each crafted to exploit vulnerabilities in different gas versions, forcing validators to constantly switch version contexts and causing performance degradation or incorrect caching behavior? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-schedule/src/ver.rs] [Module: gas_feature_versions] [Transaction intrinsic gas] The check_gas function uses gas_feature_version to determine MAXIMUM_APPROVED_TRANSACTION_SIZE (legacy vs V18+) - can version manipulation bypass size limits to submit oversized transactions that cause memory exhaustion or processing delays? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-schedule/src/ver.rs] [Module: gas_feature_versions] [Randomness gas exploit] V12+ changed randomness gas calculation - can attackers exploit the older randomness implementation at V11 to generate random values at incorrect costs, enabling biased randomness or computational DoS? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-schedule/src/ver.rs] [Constant: LATEST_GAS_FEATURE_VERSION] [Algebra gas parameter updates] The Python scripts (update_bls12381_algebra_gas_params.py, update_bn254_algebra_gas_params.py) reference LATEST_GAS_FEATURE_VERSION - can stale gas parameters for expensive algebraic operations combined with version checks allow underpriced cryptographic operations? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-schedule/src/ver.rs] [Module: gas_feature_versions] [Table operations pricing] V2 fixed 'gas formula for loading resources so that they are consistent with other global operations' - can reverting to V1 behavior through version manipulation exploit inconsistent resource/table pricing for arbitrage or economic attacks? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-schedule/src/ver.rs] [Module: gas_feature_versions] [ChangeSetConfigs version gating] V5 made ChangeSetConfigs configurable - can version manipulation force use of non-configurable ChangeSetConfigs, bypassing limits on write operations or event emissions imposed by governance? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-schedule/src/ver.rs] [Module: gas_feature_versions] [STORAGE_WRITE_LIMIT_REACHED bypass] V3 introduced aborting with STORAGE_WRITE_LIMIT_REACHED - can executing with gas_feature_version 2 bypass these limits to perform unlimited writes in a single transaction, causing state bloat? [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-gas-schedule/src/ver.rs] [Module: gas_feature_versions] [New vs existing resource pricing] V3 distinguished between new and existing resources for storage charges - can version manipulation exploit uniform pricing to perform storage operations at incorrect rates, breaking storage economic model?
